title: Simplify active result set update using set operations
Refactor handleExecute to use extracted result-manager functions
Handle parse errors with partial parsing and error display
description: When R code has parse errors, we should do partial parsing to execute everything that can be parsed successfully, and show an error in the output group for expressions that can't be parsed. This provides better feedback to users instead of failing completely.
design:
Current behavior: When parse errors occur, execution may fail completely.

Desired behavior:
1. Parse the R code and identify which expressions are valid and which have errors
2. Execute all valid expressions successfully
3. For expressions with parse errors, display an error message in the corresponding output group
4. This allows users to see partial results and understand exactly where the parse error occurred

Reuse line groups with matching line ranges in processExecutionResults
description: When processing new execution results, reuse existing line groups if they have the same lineStart/lineEnd. This prevents UI flicker and enables showing previous results during execution.
design:
Update processExecutionResults in src/results.ts to:

1. Compute new line groups as usual (call computeLineGroups)
2. For each new line group:
   - Find existing group with same lineStart AND lineEnd
   - If match found:
     - Reuse existing group ID (don't use new ID)
     - Copy existing resultIds â†’ previousResultIds of new group
   - If no match: keep new group as-is
3. Remove overlapping groups from existing line groups (current behavior)
4. Add new/reused line groups to result

Two line groups are equal if: lineStart === lineStart AND lineEnd === lineEnd
